project.teaser: ENPOWER will design, develop and demonstrate SSH-driven methodologies, interactive and closed-loop tools, and data-driven services for energy-activated citizens and energy-secure cross-sector communities towards a citizen-centric energy system. We combine leading-edge ICTs...
project.objective: ENPOWER will design, develop and demonstrate SSH-driven methodologies, interactive and closed-loop tools, and data-driven services for energy-activated citizens and energy-secure cross-sector communities towards a citizen-centric energy system. We combine leading-edge ICTs with social/behavioural dimensions and with sharing economy and value stacking business models to deploy: 1) a Social Science Framework for energy citizens activation and innovative multi-dimensional incentives for citizens’ participation in energy markets; 2) AI-based consumers clustering and segmentation algorithms; 3) interactive tools and facilitation services for energy community planning; 4) Energy Data Space adaptation to support community-level data-driven activation and interoperable automated privacy and sovereignty-preserving Demand Response (DR); 5) P2P DLT/Blockchain digital marketplace for tokenized energy and non-energy assets reciprocal compensation; 6) data-driven services and apps for energy efficiency and activation performance management; 7) ICT services and Digital Twins for community-level energy optimization and aggregated flexibility management to trade off local self-consumption against grid service provisioning, while boosting a beyond-energy community social welfare; 8) Edge monitoring hubs for automated DR; 9) Business Sandbox for novel sharing economy and social innovation-based business models; 10) methodologies for evaluating different energy community setups, upscaling and replication. ENPOWER framework will be validated along 4 Front Runners energy communities pilots and further replicated in 2 Early Adopters, covering different levels of maturity of communities, to demonstrate increased RES local self-consumption and consumers participation to the energy markets, while nurturing increased local security of supply. ENPOWER Leadership Programme and blueprints will support EU-wide replication and advice regulatory bodies on communities-friendly enabling frameworks.
project.title: Energy Activated Citizens and Data-Driven Energy-Secure Communities for a Consumer-Centric Energy System
project.keywords: Energy citizens, SSH, consumers activation, energy-secure communities, Energy Data Space, marketplace, data-driven services, closed-loop tools, planning & management, demand response, business models

article.title: Empowering communities for a citizen-centric energy systems

result.title: Energy Allocation and Settlement in Collective Self-Consumption

details.authors: João Mello, Luís Rodrigues, José Villar, João Saraiva
details.journalTitle: 2024 20th International Conference on the European Energy Market (EEM)

result.title: Gap analysis and use case capitalisation towards a consumer-centric energy system
result.description: This report will define and describe the use cases, requirements and needs to be considered towards a consumer-centric energy system. Success Criteria: Identification of current gaps and the use cases of ENPOWER project are clearly defined. (T2.1)

result.title: ENPOWER Business Sandbox
result.description: This deliverable will report the development of innovation-based business models applicable to the different ENPOWER pilots. Success Criteria: The applicability and evaluation of said models. (T2.5)

result.title: ENPOWER Pilots’ execution documentation and consumers’ engagement – pre-pilot
result.description: This deliverable will provide a description of the pilots’ use cases, engagement and social acceptance actions, overall activity monitoring and impact analysis in relation to the pre-pilot cycle running during M14-16 period. Success Criteria: The availability of the report in relation to pre-pilot scope at MS6 pilot pre-phase completion. (T6.2, T6.3, T6.4, T6.5, T6.6, T6.7)

result.title: ‘First wave’ of ENPOWER data-driven services for energy-secure communities
result.description: The deliverable will report about the first release of the ENPOWER data-driven services for energy-secure communities. Success criteria: Availability of first version of the data-driven services for energy-secure communities. (T5.1, T5.2, T5.3, T5.4, T5.5)

result.title: Interactive tool for consumers ‘activation’ and energy community planning (second version)
result.description: The deliverable will report on the second version of the ENPOWER Interactive tool for consumers ‘activation’ and energy community planning. Success criteria: Availability of second version of the interactive tool. (T3.1, T3.2, T3.3)

result.title: Interactive tool for consumers ‘activation’ and energy community planning (first version)
result.description: The deliverable will report on the first version of the ENPOWER Interactive tool for consumers ‘activation’ and energy community planning. Success criteria: Availability of first version of the interactive tool. (T3.1, T3.2, T3.3)

result.title: Democratise Energy Through Energy Activated Citizens and Data-Driven Communities: The ENPOWER Approach

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - ENPOWER (Energy Activated Citizens and Data-Driven Energy-Secure Communities for a Consumer-Centric Energy System)
result.teaser: In response to the recent crises, such as the COVID-19 pandemic and the Russian invasion of Ukraine, the European Union has reinforced its commitment to energy independence and sustainability through policy initiatives like REPowerEU and the European Green Deal. These efforts...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Energy Data Space adaptation and DLT/blockchain digital P2P marketplace for a consumer-centric energy system (1st technology release)
result.description: The deliverable will report about the first release of the ENPOWER Energy Data Space adaptation and DLT/blockchain digital P2P marketplace for a consumer-centric energy system. Success criteria: Availability of first version of the Energy Data Space adaptation and DLT/blockchain digital P2P marketplace. (T4.1, T4.2, T4.3, T4.4)

result.title: Playbook for data-driven energy-secure communities and a consumer-centric energy market
result.description: This deliverable will provide guidance on how to establish energy-secure and data-driven communities and operate a consumer-centric energy system. Success Criteria: The development of a visually attractive ‘playbook’. (T7.6)

result.title: High-level requirements for the ENPOWER technological, social and business framework
result.description: The deliverable will contain the high-level functional specifications related to the ENPOWER business, privacy and cyber-security framework. Success Criteria: Availability of detailed specifications for the ENPOWER framework. (T2.6)

result.title: Enabling conditions for consumer-centric energy system (incl. final versions of the ENPOWER co-creation process, segmentation, social-driven incentive mechanisms, Business Sandbox, requirements)
result.description: The deliverable will present the final versions of the ENPOWER co-creation process, segmentation, socio-economic enablers and high-level requirements and specifications. Success criteria: Availability of final version of the specifications. (T2.2, T2.3, T2.4, T2.5, T2.6)

result.title: ENPOWER visual identity and website
result.description: This document will summarise the Communication material including social media channels, project leaflet, poster and presentation video, as well as the project website to support the project dissemination. Success Criteria: The availability of the ENPOWER website, as well as the accompanying document describing the website structure and summarising communication material. (T8.1)

result.title: Active societal participation, emergence and consolidation factors of energy activated citizens and data-driven energy-secure communities
result.description: The deliverable will report the SSH-driven approach adopted and the relevant co-creation activities. Success Criteria: The availability of the report providing detailed presentation of the Social Science Framework segmentation and the relevant co-creation activities. (T2.2, T2.3, T2.4)

category.title: business models
category.displayCode: /social sciences/economics and business/business and management/business models

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
